Name: World of Wonders
Description:
In World of Wonders, you are a district Governor in a large but not grand civilization. The King will bestow his favor to the Governor that develops the most resplendent district.
You will do this by building city structures, discovering Natural Wonders and constructing Great Wonders, and thereby gain glory for your district and win. 
This game plays 2-7 players with a dynamic change in strategy depending on how many players are at the table. 
The game is unique in that the cards are used as workers to construct buildings, as well as the military to attack other players with.

Name: LFG: Looking for Group
Description:
In a world of swords and sorcery, everybody wants to quest for fame and glory! But before you can get to the glamorous part, it's time for some good old-fashioned HR.

In LFG: Looking For Group, you're trying to build an adventuring party by gathering heroes with different aptitudes and convincing them to work together! Or, you could just recruit all the shadiest scoundrels in the land.

LFG is a game of drafting; choosing resources turn by turn. Each round, you will choose one Hero from your hand to join your party. Then, you'll pass your hand to the next player. However, Heroes can use their abilities to mess with rival parties. Using them wisely will make the difference between assembling a winning team, and a dysfunctional mess!

Name: Pääministeri-peli
Description:
The box comes with two games.

First is Pääministeri-peli where players compete to be the prime minister of Finland. This is essentially a version of Afrikan tÃ¤hti set in Finland.

Players roll dice in turn order to move on a map of Finland. And they try to collect as many votes as possible until some one finds the voting token and manages to get it back to Helsinki.

When moving around the map, players turn around tokens from which they either get or lose votes.

When the voting token is returned to Helsinki, everyone counts their votes and who ever has the most is the winner.

The second game Ministeri Mylly is basically Trouble (Kimble), but with a twist.

Each player has two pieces. Pieces are moved on a round track by trowing a dice. Players try to get their peaces around the board. When they do they become ministers, and are moved to ministry. From there they might be forced to go to European Parliament.

The player that has the prime minister or otherwise highest ranking ministers is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Sundae Slingers
Description:
In Sundae Slingers players are competing sundae restaurants, attempting to create the most spectacular sundaes and construct the best restaurant, while attracting the right clientele for their menu.

Each round, players will bid for the opportunity to choose first from each of restaurant layouts, toppings and customers individually, then laying out their toppings and customers according to their placement selection. This creates a neat and satisfying tile laying puzzle powered by a simple auction mechanic. TASTY.

Sundae Slingers is the third in the ITB Lunchbox Series

—description from the publisher

Name: Trivial Pursuit Junior: Third Edition
Description:
From the Simpsons and the Addams Family, to Beantown and Bosnia...

From John Hancock and Davy Crockett, to Rapunzel and Smokey the Bear...

Here's the third edition of TRIVIAL PURSUIT JUNIOR, the special TRIVIAL PURSUIT game just for kids, with updated questions plus new questions based on what today's kids know.

This Junior version has the same game play and all the fun and challenge of the adult editions, with questions in these kid-friendly categories: Every Day, Fun, Science, Stories & Songs, Nature, and Games.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Handuł: Kupcy z Wilamowic
Description:
"HanduÅ‚" ("Trade") is an educational board game about merchants from Wilamowce - unique town in southern Poland, known for the endangered language WymysiöeryÅ›.

The players line up their pawns in front of the shops, marketplace, and town hall to purchase local goods and export them to distant austro-hungarian cities. Instead of paying for merchandise cards, players can lock their pawns on cards until the price is payed. Each transaction requires shipment - players can build their own transport route, or simply pay other players to use their carriage.

Game ends after 5 to 8 rounds and player with the most money wins.

During the game players can learn words from WymysiöeryÅ› language and see traditional Wilamowiceans' outfit.

-description from designer

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Black Friday Lantern
Description:
The Black Friday Lantern is a gear card that was included with the Black Friday Ninja miniature, which is not part of the game.

It reads:

+ 1 Evasion

On Arrival (at the start of the showdown) you may archive this and Ambush the monster.
Limit once per campaign.

Name: Arena: The Contest – Harun the Shapeshifter
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive hero.

Harun's got the only ability you execute before the match even begins: you may choose what Combat Role he is to perform! Your Team could use a Healer? Needing another melee fighter? No problem!


     1 miniature
     1 character sheet
     4 attack cards
     Token

Name: Blacking out the Moon
Description:
Players each have a board with the moon shown. On the moon are numbered spaces.

Players throw a dice and the number rolled can then cover the matching number on the moon with a blackened counter.

The winner is the first player to black out the moon with the counters.

Artwork suggest manufactured in the late 1940s to 1950s.

—user summary

Name: The War of the Orcses: Mass Battle Rules for the Orc Civil Wars
Description:
These rules describe an often overlooked period of warfare known as the Wars of the Orcses, a civil war between competing factions in the northern regions of Orcland. The war was fought between two rival branches of the House of Plantagut: the House of Lank-Pasta, associated with the emblem of the red rose growing out of the skull of a dead Angry-Vin Goblin – and the House of Yorc whose symbol was the white rose (growing out of the arse of a dead Stu-Wart Goblin). The wars lasted for over thirty years with many epic battles fought including the Battles of Stained Albans, Pewksebery and many many more. The struggle swung back and forth with first one faction in the ascendancy and then the other. The heavy loss of Orc life was both widespread and tragic – and neighbouring powers looked on with interest as Orcland seemed to tear itself apart. Eventually the war ended at the decisive Battle of Bogsworth Field and the crowning of the warlord Hen-Wee as king Hen-Wee VII. The kings position was further strengthened when Hen-Wee married Elibarf of Yorc, the daughter of Edturd IV, the most prominent Yorcist claimant to the throne of Orcland.

The Wars of the Orcses rules allow players to fight large scale battles between rival Orc armies with lots of supporting allied and mercenary units of Goblins, Hobgoblins, Trolls and Ogres. The rules included a detailed background to the conflict, the key players and a list of the major battles fought. Also included is a scenario describing the Battle of Pewksbery. If you fancy a bit of Orc on Orc action you probably need help – but either way these are the rules for you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Alien vs Predator: USCM Officer
Description:
It takes a special kind of officer to keep the roughnecks of the Colonial Marines in line. Each one was once a grunt like each man that follows him, and has elevated through the ranks from lowly Privates. As such, a Colonial Marine officer is well-trained in many different weapons and often has the pick of them when they go into battle. The sight of an angry Marine Captain wielding an Armat M41AE2 Heavy Pulse Rifle is enough to make any enemy quake in their boots!

Box contains:

1x USCM Officer Unicast model
    3x stat cards
    1x ping token

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War Collector's Edition
Description:
This Collector’s Edition box contains everything two players need to get right into the action, including fully-assembled, highly-detailed plastic miniatures, dice, tokens, quick-start rules and terrain including burnt-out cars and barricades. In addition to the All Out War Core Game, this set contains the Prelude to Woodbury solo campaign and card deck, a full set of 3D plastic scenery, a deluxe neoprene gaming mat, a booster pack of Equipment cards, the Lee and Clementine Booster and exclusive Walker Rick Grimes and One-Legged Dale Miniatures!


     11 Plastic Survivors - Rick Grimes, Carl Grimes, Derek, Patrick, Liam, Sandra, Brain Blake, plus Exclusives Lee, Clementine, One-Legged Dale and Scott Moon!
     25 Plastic Walkers including Exclusive Walker Rick Grimes!
     Scenery Booster including 4 Plastic Cars, 6 Plastic Barricades and 10 Plastic Supply Counters
     All of the Cards from the The Walking Dead Core Game, Prelude to Woodbury, and the Volume 1 Equipment Booster, including 19 Event Cards, 15 Solo Event Cards, 16 Supply Cards, and 75 Equipment Cards
     All of the Card Game Counters you need to play, including the Kill Zone Template, Threat Tracker, Double-Sided Ruler, Card Scenery and more!
     11 Walking Dead Dice, including 6 Red, 2 White, 1 Blue, 1 Black Action Dice, and 1 Yellow Panic Dice
     Deluxe Neoprene Atlanta Suburbs Mat
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Dale, Prison Advisor Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Dale and Scott to your games, along with Walker Rick!.

Contents:


    Plastic Dale and Scott moon Miniatures
    Plastic Walker Rick Miniature
    Dale, Prison Advisor, and Scott Moon Character Cards
    Beretta 92, Colt 1911, Meds, and Prosthetic Leg Equipment Cards
    Mantic Points
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Pyrabec Game
Description:
Essentially a roll and move game.

The game board consists of a 3D plastic pyramid with a track running around the outside. This track is indented to hold marbles in place. Some of the spaces have holes which drop the marble to lower levels of the pyramid. Each player has 3 marbles which they have to get to the top of the pyramid. Roll the die to determine how many spaces your marble can move and try to avoid the holes.

The first player to get all three marbles to the top is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Badass Riders: Arsenal Box
Description:
Premium box to keep the components of Badass Riders (core) and Four Horsemen (expansion).
It includes plastic miniatures of the vehicles and extra card pack.

Name: Bologna 1945
Description:
The Battle of Bologna, fought in April 1945, was the last battle of the Polish 2nd Corps. It was the end of the Second World War, however, Germans were not eager to surrender, especially to the Poles. They defended each of their positions fiercely, often using mines and traps. But the determined attack of the Polish soldiers freed Bologna, ending the combat trail of the Polish forces in Italy.

This game uses Taktyka i Strategia's 2nd World War "WB95" system. The game is in Polish, but translations of the rules are available form the publisher and are made available upon request (if they are not sent right away).
Families: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Rise of Kings
Description:
5 POPULATIONS. 4 NATIONS, 2 GAME MODES, 1 KING This board game is set in the Medieval Northern Europe and is a fusion of several board games and video games that have made the history of entertainment. It consists of over 900 pieces including soldiers, officers, relics, constructions and dices as well as an IOS and ANDROID APP.

The object of the game is to become the King of the Empire subduing other population in a economical war.  Choose your population and, turn after turn, evolve to unlock features that will allow you to attack your enemies more effectively and move through land and sea faster. Conquer territories, capitals and relics on the gameboard, earn points in the APP and evolve to subdue the other population.

—description from the designer

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Absurd Box
Description:
The all-new Absurd Box contains 300 mind-bending cards that came to us after taking peyote and wandering the desert.

- 300 brand-new cards to mix into your game.
- This one's pretty weird.
- This is an expansion. Requires the main game.
- You have nothing to lose but your chains!

-From Publisher's Website

Name: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG: Structure Deck – Powercode Link
Description:
This is the 42nd Deck in the TCG's Structure Deck series.

Create brand new Link Summoning combinations with Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME Structure Deck: Powercode Link! This Deck features a new “Code Talker” Link Monster plus LINK-2 and LINK-3 monsters you can Summon using any monsters, and whose Link Arrows all point to your own Main Monster Zones!

Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME Structure Deck: Powercode Link is a great second step for Duelists who started Dueling with Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME Starter Deck: Codebreaker. Co-Link your Transcode Talker from Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME Starter Deck: Codebreaker with Powercode Talker to boost both monsters by 500 ATK and make them untargetable by opposing card effects! The added protection helps keep Powercode Talker ready to make double-powered attacks every turn.

Finally, for Duelists that like to live dangerously, a new Field Spell gives you a chance to Special Summon a random Cyberse-Type Link Monster directly from your Extra Deck without having to Link Summon or use any monsters as Materials. But to claim that reward, you have to take 2000 or more damage from one battle or card effect, simulating Playmaker’s “Storm Access” skill from the animated series!


Each Structure Deck contains:


     38 Common Cards, 2 Ultra Rare Cards, 3 Super Rare Cards, 1 Beginner‘s Guide and 1 Double-sided Deluxe Game Mat/Dueling Guide


—description from the publisher

Name: Squadron Strike: Traveller
Description:
In the tradition of Squadron Strike, this boxed set is a complete game released after a Kickstarter fulfillment of 2 years.

The Wars of the Third Imperium are handled in High Guard for large fleet actions. There are plenty of other battles that require a finer scale with more detail per ship, and Squadron Strike: Traveller provides that detail, while bringing Traveller space combat into fully realized 3D vector movement.

The boxed set contains everything you need to play Traveller ships in the Squadron Strike engine.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Król Popiel
Description:
Old polish legend says that a swarm of mice had emerged from the Goplo lake and eaten evil king Popiel as a punishment for his malicious reign. 
In this game the players alternately place mice tiles on the Kruszwica tower, where Popiel fled. The better the tile fits on the board, the more points it scores. If tile touches Popiel's pawn, player gets random bonus (another move, points multiplier etc.), and evil king retreats to upper foors. Game ends when he can flee no more. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: What Do You Meme?: Fresh Memes Expansion Pack #2
Description: Treat yourself to even more memes! 115 Cards (90 caption cards & 25 photo cards) to be added to core game. You deserve this. You're pretty great.

Name: Hands up ramasjang
Description:
Oh no ? The villains have escaped. Help Christians to catch them. Roll the colored dice, and catch the fast and cunning villains. The more you catch, the better. Excitement for the whole family.

... a game about the Danish childrens show "Ramasjang mysteriet" for the youngest players.

Players take turn rolling the two dice. The color on the dice show which villain figures the player gets. If there's no more figures of a villain, you can instead steal that villain from an opponent - but only if he does not have two of that kind.
The player ending with the most pairs of villains win.

—user summary

Name: Risk: Rick and Morty
Description:
Play the classic game of strategic conquest with a Rick And Morty twist. This custom Risk edition features factions of beings from the show, vying for control of Planets and Locations along the Central Finite Curve. The five power driven factions include Mythologs, Robot Dogs, Gazorpians, Post-Apocalyptic People, and of course, the U.S. Government. Each faction will have its own Leader that grants extra power in the territory the Leader occupies.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Quadrille
Description:
Quadrille is a four-player hidden identity game. One player is the girl in the forest, the other players are witches trying to kill the girl. One if the witches can be a traitor. If the girl finds the sword in the forest, she becomes the Hero who can kill the witches. It's up to the witches to see to that this does not happen.

The game consists of 12 cards and 25 markers.

-User summary

Name: ベビーカーでGO! (Go with the Stroller!)
Description:
ãƒ™ãƒ“ãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ¼ã§GO! (Go with the Stroller!) is a simple co-operative card game in which the players are all moms out with their strollers and need to reach the goal.

Each turn, the player draws a card, then plays one. A go! card makes the player advance. A trouble card is played in front of any player and blocks that player from advancing. Troubles can be overcome by a die roll or playing a help card.

Once all moms have advanced ten steps, the players win. Otherwise they lose.

Name: Svenska växter
Description:
The game consists of a deck of 100 cards. On each card is a different flower which are grouped into 27 different sets. The objective is to complete sets of flowers by asking your fellow gamers for cards in the sets you already have and drawing a card from the draw pile in case they did not have the card you asked for. The game continues until the draw deck runs out and then you count points depending on how many sets you have collected and a few other criteria.

—user summary

Name: Ultimate Scheme: Plan Number B
Description:
What’s even better than pulling off scores of nefarious plots and capers? Pulling off dozens more, of course! Plan Number B is an expansion to the Ultimate Scheme game that provides you with more factions, more schemes, more action cards, and more mayhem in general.

Plan Number B begins as a set of 40 new cards, introducing the following new components:
- A new deck of 21 Power Schemes
- 5 new Factions
- 3 new Ultimate Schemes
- 2 new X-factors
- 9 new Action Cards
- Interpol Agent rules (a new game element that lets you use the forces of law and order as your unwitting pawns to obstruct your rival's plans.)

—description from the publisher

Name: Pac-Man Maze Craze
Description:
It's a race to collect the fruit as you roll the die and move around the "screen" just like the video game.  But look out for the ghosts, Blinky, Pinky, Inky and Clyde!  They'll try to get in your way and keep you from moving around the board and collecting your fruit.
—description from the publisher

Pac-Man Maze Craze was a Wendy's Kids' Meal giveaway based on the classic video game.  Players roll a special die to move around a board representing the Pac-Man screen and collect a designated number of fruit tokens.  Landing on a ghost token ends a player's turn and blocks a path.  Rolling a ghost on the die causes loss of a fruit token.  First player to return to the start with the right number of tokens wins.

—user summary

Name: Ruins Raiders
Description:
Imagine a cooperative exploration game in the tradition of Indiana Jones with a "lite" blend of a good ol' fashioned dungeon crawl using modular tiles and deadly traps.

It even has a light battle mechanic, so players can choose whether to work together or to betray their friends in their quest to escape alive with the master treasure chest. Players will take turns moving through the dungeon, building it as they go, and using up to 3 actions each turn. Traps spring up randomly, as do monsters... and glorious treasure. Treasure cards reveal bonuses to movement and combat. At any point a player may decide to attack another player and escape alone with the treasure, becoming the only winner at the table.

And the best part is, all the mechanics work well either in large groups, small groups, or even solo.

It's a "lite" tabletop roleplaying game with a very basic dungeon crawl that can be done co-op, solo, or even versus.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Spooky Game
Description:
The Spooky Game is a simple spin-and-move game contained in The Spooky Box of Books boxed set.  Players spin to move their tokens on a track decorated with various scary creatures.  Some space move the players forward or back, offer short cuts or cause loss of a turn.  To win, a player must land on the finish space exactly.

—user summary

Name: Race Car Rally
Description:
In Race Car Rally, players roll a die to move their markers around a race track.  Spaces with oil spills move players back two spaces.  An oil can moves a player two spaces forward. The first player to complete a lap and reach the finish wins.

This game is included in the book Cars and Trucks Sticker Jigsaw Book.

—user summary

Name: Dice Fight: Chicken Edition
Description:
Dice Fight: Chicken Edition is a fun, quick-moving, easy-to-learn, light strategy game.  Players can learn how to play in three minutes and finish the game in about 20 minutes.

Players each begin with 10 unique chickens and 10 cards.  In each round, players present a chicken to the dice fight, roll dice simultaneously, then send losing chickens to the fried-chicken carry-out bucket.  But before sending a losing chicken to the bucket, players will determine whether or not to play a card that can alter the outcome of the dice roll. 
 Players will fall in love with the adorable chickens and become heartbroken when their favorites are tragically sent to the carry-out bucket.  But if you play your cards right and get just a little bit of luck from the dice, it will be winner winner chicken dinner!

—description from the publisher

Name: 16 Chickens Dice Fight to the Death
Description:
When you play 16 Chickens: Dice Fight to the Death, you’ll build a team of up to 16 chickens to help you eliminate your opponents.

You'll experience four fast-paced phases featuring card drafting, team building, dice rolling, and discarding action cards at just the right moment.  Each phase incorporates a careful balance of strategy, unexpected decision points, and just enough chance to create a tabletop game experience that’s fun for everyone.  You’ll fall in love with the adorable little chickens and become heartbroken when your favorites are tragically sent to the fried chicken carry-out bucket.

But if you and your chickens can endure enough dice fights and outlast your opponents, it’ll be winner winner chicken dinner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Murder at Tara
Description:
Murder at Tara, An ACOS Gay Game.  A Role-Playing Murder Mystery game for eight Adults.

MURDER AT TARA
Someone murdered Villain Legree, that scoundrel scalawag who was determined to steal Tara from poor Miss Harlot O'Hara by raising her taxes sky high. Villain used to be the cruel overseer at Tara, but now he's just dead.
It's up to you and your guests to discover who murdered Villain Legree - and why.

THE SUSPECTS
Harlot O'Hara --- beautiful owner of Tara Plantation. Since Villain saw her without her dress, it was curtains for her. People thought she was sweet on Lark Gaybelle, but perhaps everything was not as it seemed at Tara
Lark Gaybelle --- handsome stranger, hired to build a levee across Tara's lowland to help prevent the pasture from flooding. A dapper man, never without this spats and gold-handled walking cane, he made more than one's heart throb at Tara.
Butterfly the Queen ---- Miss Harlot's personal srvant. Flighty as his name, he was always there to lay out Miss Harlot's clothes -- and sometimes her beaux.
Leslie Coward --- the owner of the elegant neighboring plantation, Thirteen Oaks, and Oblivion's husband. Bespectacled and nervous as a mouse on a hot tin cat, he was afraid of his own shadow - especially one dark shadow from his past.
Oblivion Dehavilland, sweet wife of Leslie Coward. Oblivion, poor dear, was a bit forgetful since the onset of mental pause.
Rough and Ready the Tarlton Twins, fro the neighboring plantation, Fetish Hall. They were wild and kinky guys, and their lives were somehow entwined with poor dead Villain Legree. They both had meaningful relationships with various animals, vegetables, minerals, and sometimes even humans.
Mammy Dearest, Tara's faithful servant. She stalked the halls of Tara with her padded shoulders, serving Pepsi and True Grits in Southern style. She knew most of Tara's dark secrets, and she had a few dark secrets of her own.

—description from the publisher

Name: Murder in Key West
Description:
An ACOS Gay Game.  A role-playing murder mystery.  Includes audio cassette tape.

"Someone murdered Donny Doornail, beloved Owner of the Lambda Lodge in Key West."

Invite your friends!  Assign each a role.  Play the game that lets you solve The Murder!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice & Danger: Dragon's Lair
Description:
The dragon Firethrax has left his lair to take a bath in a nearby lake, leaving his treasure unguarded. Your band of adventurers teleports to his treasure to claim it, but you must evade traps and battle monsters to escape. Just when you think you have reached the exit, Firethrax returns to stop you! Which adventurer among you will defeat the dragon to claim victory?

Dice & Danger: Dragon's Lair is a board game designed to introduce younger children to the basic concepts of fantasy role-playing games. It is a simple race game in which players try to be the first to defeat the dragon at the last space on the board. Players take on the roles of various fantasy characters and start the game with three treasure cards, which allow them to perform actions or add to their combat die roll. A ten-sided die determines movement and combat. The spaces on the board are either free spaces or encounter spaces. The encounter spaces can be traps, monsters, or the single Holy Fountain treasure space. The monsters become progressively more difficult to defeat along the track, culminating in Firethrax the dragon. Defeating a monster rewards the player with a new treasure card, but losing to a monster means losing the next turn. The first player to defeat Firethrax wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hammer and Nails: A Card Tile Game
Description:
Basics of Hammer and Nails – A Card Tile Game

Competing players take turns constructing a dynamic Build Stack using cards played from their hand. The objective is to have the fewest number of total Nails, including visible Nails on the Build Stack at the end of the game.

Players tactically stack the cards which produce interesting outcomes for placement of their opponents' cards.  Typically, Players have 4 cards in hand, plays one per turn and draws or discards cards at end of their turn.

The rule set, percentages of mechanics, and location of the Hammers and Nails have been designed to provide a challenge and encourage players to engage in tactical thinking.  The format and rules engine allows any level of experience an opportunity to enjoy a competitive game, however the game scales in it's competitive nature as players advance and formulate their adaptive play style during a game.

Welcome to the unique competitive Build Stack of Card Tiles!

—description from the designer

Name: Dicehack
Description: The Node protects some of the corporate worlds most valuable information, but a group of hackers has found a backdoor. Be the first to exploit this weakness and gain access to the treasures of the Node. Other hackers are hot on your heels, so you'll have to bring all your talents to bear. Each player in Dicehack is competing against the others. Games take 45-60 minutes, depending on the number of players. The player boards provide nearly all the reference information you'll need to play. Game play is a combination of wagering resources, luck of the roll, and strategy in capturing, attacking, and defending. Players roll dice and try to add or multiply them to unlock a series of spaces in the Fibonacci Sequence. Math is not for everyone, but you can win at Dicehack using the calculator on your smartphone. You'll wager the number of dice you'll need to open spaces on your board, to attack other players and set them back, to protect your own spaces from attack, and to allow you to change faces on other dice. You'll choose your targets, use your number skills, and manage your resources. The first player that unlocks all eight spaces on their board wins the game.

Name: Seize the Bean: 5-6 Player Expansion
Description: This expansion includes two more dual-layer player boards (with unique artwork), an extra 6 Founder cards, 20 extra resources (resin milk cartons and sugar cubes), and 4 extra barista meeples.

Name: Blindfolded Twister
Description:
The game that ties you up in knots now features blindfolds and textured shapes for a touch of mystery and loads of fun! In the Blindfolded Twister game, players still move to spots on the mat, but now they do it wearing blindfolds and play completely by touch and memory. The player chosen as the Spinner calls out the moves on the game spinner, and then the players wearing blindfolds feel around the textured shapes with their hands and feet to move around the mat. Get ready for loads of laughs whether playing the game or just watching! It's hilarious to see how players can end up in some really funny and awkward positions. Who will be the last player standing to win?

—description from the publisher

Name: Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game
Description:
Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game is a 2–5 player card game parodying "Trading card game" mechanisms. Cards include a variety of over-powered cards that form a strange balance.

Based on the IP "Pop Team Epic"

—user summary

Name: Kartulikuhi
Description:
"Potetoepile" in English.
Players take turns to filling the circles. After Your turn if all
circles in any horizontal, vertical or diagonal row have filled cross out that row and write up the number of crossed circles as
a points. The game ends if all circles are crossed out. The winner is the player with the most points.

—user summary
Families: Series: Travel Games for Smart Kids (Goldmerk)

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Hero Pack – Sigrid Thane/Skald
Description:
Additional hero for Ancient Chronicles that can also be played with Immortal Souls.

—user summary

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Genryu/Shakiko Hero Pack
Description:
Additional hero for Ancient Chronicles that can also be played with Immortal Souls.
—user summary

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Chaotic Familiars
Description:
The world of Sword & Sorcery is imbued with many mystical secrets, and familiars are but one of these! In this set players can find five intelligent little creatures that are able to create a magical link with their humanoid friends.

The ancient scrolls of the Archmagi classify Chaotic familiars into three types, each characterized by a deep bond with their owner: Domestic (Cat, Crow); Wild (Bat); Legendary (Drakeling, Imp).

Each of these Familiars provides valuable help on the battlefield or grants peculiar abilities to its owner, such as the life-drinking of an Imp, or the poisonous spittle of a Drakeling. But this deep bond has a downside. When a Familiar dies, its owner suffers a terrible mental shock, which hampers their skills for a time.

This expansion can be used with any Sword & Sorcery Quest or Campaign (Immortal Souls or Ancient Chronicles), by simply shuffling the Familiar cards into the Treasure deck.

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Lawful Familiars
Description:
The world of Sword & Sorcery is imbued with many mystical secrets, and familiars are but one of these! In this set players can find five intelligent little creatures that are able to create a magical link with their humanoid friends.

The ancient scrolls of the Archmagi classify Lawful familiars into three types, each characterized by a deep bond with their owner: Domestic (Dog); Wild (Boar, Horned Lizard, Owl); Legendary (Pixie).

Each of these Familiars provides valuable help on the battlefield or grants peculiar abilities to its owner, such as the superior sense of smell of a Dog or mystic enchantments of a Pixie. But this deep bond has a downside. When a Familiar dies, its owner suffers a terrible mental shock, which hampers their skills for a time.

This expansion can be used with any Sword & Sorcery Quest or Campaign (Immortal Souls or Ancient Chronicles), by simply shuffling the Familiar cards into the Treasure deck.

Name: LunaTix: Solar System
Description:
This first expansion to LunaTix: Star Trackers adds planet observation and quest tokens such as vehicle upgrades, astronomical items and flags with an astronomical theme. Items and flags require certain observations an they need to be brought back to their location of origin. New hidden agendas are added to combine observations with planets. Solar System brings new ways to enjoy solo games.

—description from the publisher

Name: LunaTix: Lunar Lander
Description:
This second expansion of LunaTix: Star Trackers is an anniversary expansion of 2019 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the first Apollo landing. The game expands to actually landing on the Moon depending on your revealed mission. This can even result in an Apollo 8, 10 or 13 mission, which has other missions than landing due to the historic situation. In this game both inclination and altitude are combined with maneuvering and economic fuel usage. A way back to Earth is required to finish the game. The winner in this expansion has the most point, based on efficient maneuvering and a fast return after mission execution. Co-op in teams is encouraged in this expansion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Moderner Wettkampf
Description:
This is a race between a runner, an automobile and an aeroplane.
The players start at space 1 and have to reach space 40 to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. There are 3 tracks on the game board. The runners use the pink and blue spaces, the automobiles the white dots and the aeroplanes the light and dark brown spaces. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: OK Play Duel
Description:
The perfect travelling game for any player in any occasion. Just grab a stack of tiles and keep laying them down until you hit five in a row. Easy as pie… or at least it would be. Unfortunately, there’s another player opposite you who’s trying to do the exact same thing.

Now you’ll have to worry about where they’re going and what they’re planning, all on a board with absolutely no boundaries. As you’ll soon find out it’s a game that’s very easy to learn – but tricky to win.

Try to sneak a straight or diagonal line of five or your tiles before your opponent. If you run out of tiles, you can reposition them until someone wins.

Name: Norsaga: PAX 2018 Promo Cards
Description:
Promotional cards from PAX East 2018.

4 double-sided cards that expand Norsaga: Odds and Endings.

Immortal - Guardian: Tuva Sunwrath (Might)
Immortal - Guardian: Just Grame (Lore)
Immortal - Guardian: The Insatiable Wishard (Craft)
Immortal - Guardian: Pol at the Threshold (Faith)

Gameplay
These cards function identically to the Guardian Immortal cards found in Norsaga: Odds and Endings. When playing with Immortals, shuffle these in for additional variety.

Name: Battlestations: Second Edition – Advanced Rule Book
Description:
You and your friends are crewmates on a starship on amazing voyages where you will fight enemy ships and space monsters, explore strange secrets, make daring rescues and escapes, solve mysteries, and save the galaxy.

This book contains the definitive complete second edition rules, compatible with all original game pieces or with the new second edition boxed set.

Includes:

60 missions including 35 inspired or designed by famous designers

30 species

140+ special abilities

12 modules

120+ pieces of personal equipment

50+ cargo bay items

150+ treasure items

100+ starship layouts

Name: Hexe, Tier … wer fehlt denn hier?
Description:
To start Hexe, Tier … wer fehlt denn hier?, divide the cards evenly among all players, with these cards lying face up on the table in front of each player. Each card shows a young witch flying on a broom, with one or more animals accompanying her.

On a turn, one player rolls the two dice, which show various animals on them. If different animals show on the dice, then each player can turn face down all cards on which these two animals are depicted. If the same animal shows on both dice, then you have to look for only this animal on your cards. Whoever turns all their cards face down first wins the round, claiming all the face-up cards remaining in front of other players. Players then turn all their cards face up and begin a new round, which will likely favor those with fewer cards since they have less to flip over to win. At the end of three rounds, whoever has the most cards in front of them wins.

Name: Invictus: the Shogun
Description:
Invictus the Shogun is a 2 player tactical card game. The player will be the King and fight with opponent. While fighting with opponent’s army on the battlefield you must take care of your Kingdom because in this game, building better Kingdom than opponent’s, also let you win the game.

Destroying the enemy soldier might not always be the best move in this game. Capture them and make them your own to prosper your land.
There are multiple ways to use each card. You may use it as a soldier, as a citizen and as an assistance force. Use your cards wisely to win the battle.

2 player battle card game combined with unique mechanics such as Kingdom and Reserve, will lead you to the next Battlefield.

—description from the designer

Name: Cage Match!: The MMA Fight Game
Description:
Cage Match! is the tabletop game of head-to-head, mixed martial arts combat. Styles makes fights!  Control a mixed martial arts fighter from a variety of backgrounds, from boxing to freestyle wrestling to Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. Defeat your opponent by knock out or submission. Secretly select your move, gain focus and then spend it on power moves. Every move has a counter and it might come down to a roll of the dice. Step into the cage!

—description from the publisher

Name: USA On The Road
Description:
USA On The Road is a spin-and-move game originally included in Chik-fil-a kids meals.  Players spin to move along a track that traverses the United States.  Some spaces cause players to move forward, back or lose a turn.  Other spaces ask players to do some sort of activity (e.g. pretend to water-ski or tell a story), sometimes earning an extra move or spin.  The first player to reach the Statue of Liberty wins.

On the back of the game board is one section of a five-part game called "Our Big World."

—user summary

Name: The Path to Glory
Description:
The Path to Glory is a roll-and-move game originally published in England Activity Book, filled with various games and puzzles about the England soccer (football) team.

Players roll a die to move along a track representing a soccer game.  Some spaces represent positive or negative events in the game, and move players forward or backward or even allow a roll for an instant win.  The first player to reach the goal at the end of the track wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Saalehkanda
Description:
Saalehkanda is a game of strategy and skill in which two opponents shoot stones (round wooden playing pieces) on a 115x70cm playing table. Saalehkanda is enjoyable for players ages 8 years and up. Playing time is approximately 10-35 minutes.
The winner of the game
is the player who first earns 50 or more points by either
       Scoring goals, 
       Pocketing the opponent‘s stones, or 
       Checking the center.
—description from the rulebook

Name: Faules-ei
Description:
A short quick card game in which you quickly pass around a card from you hand, until you have a set of four of the same colour. Don't get stuck with the black egg, the "faules-ei".

—user summary

Name: The Sound of Sirens
Description:
We've all heard about the legends of the sirens, who with their irresistible voices lure the ships of unsuspecting sailors onto the cliffs... But did you know that they all sing in different musical styles? That's because not every sailor is attracted to the same type of music! Duh!

Every 100 years, the sirens of the salty sea wake up from their slumber, to organize the Sirenade festival. Siren clans from across the seven oceans send their most famous stars to vie for the prestigious honor of... Well, being the most badass clan!

The Sound of Sirens is a racing game with a lot of interaction between the players. Each player leads a clan of sirens, and each clan is represented by a musical genre: Pop, Ballad, Rap, and Rock.

On your turn, you will be playing action cards from your hand in order to be the first to lure your assigned ship onto the cliffs. But many surprises await along the way… Do you have what it takes to become a legendary siren?

Name: プーさん ハニーコレクション (Winnie-the-Pooh Honey Collection)
Q.E.: Fifth Player Expansion
Description:
This expansion allows Q.E. to be played with five players and includes an additional nation and an additional industry for that fifth player, along with new company tiles to cover these, as well as new "view winning bid" tokens which give players the option to see what the winning bid was in one auction of their choice during the game.

It also introduces a new scoring opportunity: "Globalization", which awards points for players investing in companies with nationalities other than their own.

Name: The Crucible of Classic Critters: Woodlands Dungeons for Four Against Darkness
Description:
Woodlands dungeons for Four Against the Darkness for characters of level 4+

Description from the publisher:

The Crucible of Classic Critters is a supplement for Four Against Darkness offering tables, monsters, spells, magic items and special events to explore the woodlands using a new set of room and corridor tiles with elements such as trees, bridges and rivers.

Includes new rules for:

• Woodlands tables

• Animal companions and mounts

• Flying Monsters

• Subduing monsters

• Swimming (and drowning)

• A new class: the beastmaster

• Two new cleric variants

• Additional magic items and spells

• Additional monsters

40 pages, black and white illustrations.  Requires only the core Four Against Darkness book.

Name: Crazy Volley
Description:
In Crazy Volley, you take control of a Volley team along one match. In the game, you have to sign Volley players to try to win the Volley match against other team.

The game is divided in turns: the first team that reach to win seven turns, scoring a point, win the game.
The game is composed by three kind of card:
Players, Who will be placed in field to play the match, doing their actions when the ball arrive in their field.
Referee, who can influence a turn.
Wtf card, that can change EVERYTHING!!!

But... in crazy Volley nothing is like it seems. In fact you can win the game also KILLING the players in other field...

—description from the designer

Name: Pyrrhus Imperator
Description:
This games covers the campaign of Pyrrhus, king of Epirus, in southern Italy and Sicily to help the Greek cities threatened by the Romans and Carthaginians, from 279 to 275 BCE.

One player commands the Epirotes, Samnites, Etruscans and Greeks; the other player commands the Romans and Carthaginians.
The Campanians and Mamertines are neutral

Duration: 1 to 3 hours
    Scales: 500 to 2,000 soldiers or 10 elephants or 10 siege weapons or 10 quinqueremes.
    Modules: 1 strategic module and 1 tactical module
    1 round: 6 months

(source: rulebook)

Name: Lions and Tigers and Bears, Oh My!
Description:
In each round of the fast-paced, dice rolling game Lions and Tigers and Bears, Oh My!, each player rolls their dice and scores based on who can boast the best beasts. Kingly lions are worth four points, tigers tally three points, and bears bring two points each. If you roll a blank, oh my!, that die is removed from play.

In more detail, on each turn, you roll your dice, then choose only one type of animal to count toward your score. Once you choose your scoring animal, you can re-roll the rest of your dice to see whether you can score more points that turn — but be careful as any blanks you get from re-rolling cause you to lose that die for the rest of the game. As soon as all players have lost all of their dice, the game ends and whoever has the most points wins.

Name: Who is Stronger?
Description:
A tower defense game set in near-future East Asia (plus USA):
Aliens are attacking the countries of the players - they appear on the top of the board and are pushed down, when more aliens appear. Aliens that reach the bottom destroy the buildings there.

Players can fight the aliens by buying military units - They destroy the aliens, which then leave a "core" that can be exchanged for money.

Your objective depends partly on your secret objective card - some gain points for helping the aliens destroy certain opponents, others have to concentrate on defense or making money. There is only one winner.

—user summary

Name: Pictionary Pocket
Description:
As a boiled down version of it's bigger brother Pictionary Pocket has the same basic game play.
One player draws pictures, inspired by cards with different categories on them, and their team mates need to guess what has been drawn. If they do in a minute, they can go again, otherwise the other team has a go. Different categories score differently, whichever team reaches 10 points first, wins. Different to other versions of Pictionary, in this games a card draw decides which category is used by the player, not a die throw.

—user summary

Name: Madeira: Expansion
Description:
This planned expansion for Madeira should've been included in the Collector's Edition and been available separately. Unfortunately the kickstarter never delivered, and this expansion was never seen.

Original publisher's description:

Madeira Expansion 
Madeira will never be the same. With this modular expansion you can add new challenges to your game of Madeira. You may combine the modules in any way you choose to and personalize your gaming experience. One thing is for sure, no game will ever be the same and the challenge will increase. Do you have what it takes?

Module #1 New Beginning - 24 Starting Tiles
Module #2 Capitanias - 24 Capitania Cards
Module #3 King's Demands - 30 Unique Crown's Requests 
Module #4 New Roles - 5 New Characters, Pirate Meeple, Pirate Ship, Corsair Die, 10 special tiles

Name: WarpShips
Description:
A Components: Looney Pyramid Games spaceship maneuvering game.

You will need 36 Looney Pyramids - 3 trios each of 4 colors (Red, Green, Blue, Yellow), a Pyramid Die, and a Starship Captain tin (or similar circular object, like a coaster or a CD).

Colonial ships move by distorting space-time and reappearing at the outer edge of a warp field. After they move, they fire energy beams that teleport other differently-colored ships far across the galaxy. Your mission: harness these warp energy beams to transport a diverse collection of ships, and be the first to form a complete colony!

You and your opponents move ships around the play area via the “warp” using the Starship Captain tin lid to measure distance and direction of travel. After a ship warps, it fires its teleportation beam at another target ship. You roll the pyramid die to find out if the beam successfully teleports the target ship out of the play area and into your own colony.
The goal is to be the first to teleport a combination of ships into your colony: The first player to colonize either two monochrome trios of ships or two ships of every color, wins the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Tiny Epic Zombies: Kickstarter Deluxe Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack includes the Deluxe content offered for Tiny Epic Zombies during its Kickstarter.

This promo pack includes:

4 playable characters - the Burglar, the Lawyer, the Farmer and the Trucker.

5 search cards - the Service Dog, the Katana, the Bazooka and 2 Ninja Stars.

2 ITEMeeple items - the Katana and the Bazooka

1 wood Dog meeple

Name: Brown Chicken, Brown Cow
Description:
Brown Chicken, Brown Cow

“Bow Chicka Bow Wow”
The funky signature sound of golden age adult movies now lives on in popular culture as “Brown Chicken, Brown Cow”. Innuendo for “Getting Down”

Now get ready to get your hands a little dirty.

A hilarious Party Game that plays in fast and fun 10 minute rounds!
Easy to learn and easy to play.
No skill required – just have some fun! The Sculpting Game Of Naughty Innuendo
Fast & Easy! Naughty & Fun!
Get your hands dirty with this hilarious party game that is easy to learn and play.
Sculpt clean versions of dirty words then guess who’s sculptures match which words to score
2 - 6 Players, Ages 17+

HOW TO PLAY
Draw an Innuendo Card.    
You have 30 seconds to sculpt a clean version of the dirty word.    
Mix up and reveal everyone’s Innuendos.    
Vote on which sculptures match which Innuendo Cards.
Draw
Draw an Innuendo Card.

Sculpt
You have 30 seconds to sculpt a clean version of the dirty word.

Mix
Mix up and reveal everyone’s Innuendos.

Vote
Vote on which sculptures match which Innuendo Cards.

Name: Mystical Conjuration
Description:
The Order of the Purple Sky is an order of sorcerers and sorcerers in Westarland.  All the chapters of the order are looking forward to the great gathering next year to celebrate the passing of the founder of the Order.  You are a member of the Binnery chapter, one of the smaller chapters of the order. You and your colleagues are anxious to make a big impression in the competitions and demonstrations.  To that end, you are competing with your sorcerer and sorceress brothers and sisters for the chance to represent your chapter at the coming Jubilee at the Order's headquarters in Pluridan.

Everyone will be cooking up new spells, practicing their best old ones, and competing like crazy people for the best slots on the jubilee program.

Mystical Conjuration is a pattern building worker placement game for 2-5 players.  It plays in about 20-25 minutes per player.

In Mystical Conjuration, you use your sorceror and familiars to collect mana from the Astral Planes, the Aether, the Maelstrom, and even the Nether.  Combine these according to different formulas on your spell forge to complete spells and earn victory points at the same time as earning rewards such as additional familiars, runes, and glyphs to help in your spell crafting.

The mana you collect can be used to complete formulas or to take actions in the process of making new spells.  Your sorceror and familiars can collect mana or manipulate mana or formulas.

Actions include acquiring new spell formulas, moving or swapping mana between magic circles, adding mana to the formula on your spell forges, and moving spell formulas between forges.

Will you be the sorceror with the most prestige and be send to represent your chapter at the Order of the Purple Sky Jubilee?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Build Time Machine Promo Card
Description: Become a lord or time and space in your games of Pursuit of Happiness with the Build Time Machine promo card!

Name: Mort-A-Mania
Description:
Welcome to Mort-A-Mania, the knock-down, drag-out, fight-night clash! Take on the role of necrosurgeon as you build your fighter out of the animated remains of last week’s toughest contenders. Purchase tumultuous tonics, scintillating spellbooks, and battle-ready body parts at auction using your own life; who needed those last 10 years anyway? Set your monstrosities against one another in a free-for-all winner-take-all combat to the undeath!

Mort-A-Mania is a quick-play beat’em up card game that’s approachable to all levels with an emphasis on player interaction. Spellbooks, tonics, and body parts keep the combat engaging and visceral. Perfect for a quick match or an all-night tournament, Mort-A-Mania promises to provide perpetual play and politics in practically precise proportions.
 It’s Magnificent! It’s Mayhem! It’s…

Mort-A-Mania!

Mort-A-Mania is played in rounds, each round beginning with an auction. Cards are dealt onto the table for all players to see, then each player secretly bids on each card. When all players are ready, bids are revealed and the highest bidder on each card wins it and pays the bid out of their life pool.

After the Auction comes the Combat, where players take turns using their newly purchased limbs, spells and tonics to deal damage to their opponents. After everyone has taken their actions and the dust settles, damage is tallied up, dead players are eliminated, and the game moves to the next round.

When only one player left alive, they are declared that winner!

Name: Dread Streets: The Cinematic Swashbuckling Game
Description:
As far as the eye can see, it stretches on and on, the endless cityscape known only as the Dread Streets. In the afternoon, true to form, the Commoners bar their doors and windows. For the Heroes of Dread Streets are about to awake from their drunken sleep, to beat each other up in yet another senseless brawl!

Dread Streets lets you direct a swashbuckling movie, complete with ridiculous stunts, pirates, musketeers, freaks, drinking, brawling and lots of taunting.

After having toured conventions in Denmark since 2013 we’re finally bringing you the complete Dread Streets game as a printer-friendly PDF, complete with printable miniatures, cards and tokens.

FIRST YOU ROLL – THEN YOU PLAN! Your turn won’t be ruined by bad luck. You roll the dice before you decide what to do, then you plan accordingly. Experience humble success instead of epic fiasco!
MULTIPLAYER. Three's not a crowd with Dread Streets. It plays equally well with 2, 3 or 4 players.
COMPATIBLE. Dread Streets is designed with 25-28mm miniatures in mind, but our Zone system lets you use any size of miniature and/or battle map.
NO MEASURING. The play area is defined by the placement of buildings and terrain, not by strictly measured distances.
COMPLETE … SORT OF. The game comes with printable miniatures, cards and tokens. You only need to supply a battle map, terrain, snacks and booze!

—description from the publisher:

Name: Frog Soup
Description:
“Frog Soup”, a cooperative game of jumping frogs.

The Witch is cooking a frog soup, and you are the last ingredients to the recipe. So, cooperate, jump and try to spill the soup before she puts you in the cauldron.

Frog Soup is a cooperative skill game where you will have to hit big targets on the table with your jumping frogs.

Try to hit all the magical items in the correct sequence to remove the magical protections of the Witch and escape! 
Beware! The Witch adds one ingredient per round in her cauldron. If she finishes her recipe (6 turns), everybody loses!

Children and adults alike will have a lot of fun in play this exciting skill cooperative game. 
“Frog Soup” is a game for 1 to 4 players, from 5 years old.

-description from publisher

Name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Arkham Nights 2018 Promotional Character Card Set
Description:
One new, official, Investigator, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 19-20 October 2018.

Consists of the following items:

“Ashcan” Pete Investigator Sheet
“Ashcan” Pete Investigator Token
Dark Dreams Talent Card
Duke Ally Card
Pete’s Guitar Item Card

Promo included in the Expansion Under Dark Waves
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Forage, The Bee Game
Description:
Fill your beehive with nectar, pollen and bees to survive the coming winter in this uniquely strategic Euro-style game about bees and the natural environment.

Raise forager bees to collect nectar & guard your hive, nurse bees to care for your babies & raise male drone bees to eat other players honey. The aim is to collect (or rob!) as much nectar as you can before winter arrives, while avoiding bears, beekeepers and other pests.

This game is designed to play as competitively or cooperatively as you choose, when playing with children you can choose to not rob their hives and hold onto your cards, or you may like to target the older players, those who are getting ahead, or your husband / wife.

There are 3 ways to play the game:
1. Child’s Play 15-30min
â€¨For younger children, 6-10yrsâ€¨
A simpler version of the game without drones, complicated dice rules etcâ€¨

2. Standard Gameâ€¨ 60-90min
Adults and kids 10yrs+, play until the first beehive is full.
Good for beginners and introduces strategy. Drones are rarely usedâ€¨.

3. Extended Game 90-120min
Adults and kids 12yrs+, play until all nectar & pollen taken from board.
Much more strategic, drones are used extensively to steal from each others hives

A aesthetically pleasing game which focuses on touch and feel, with wooden hexagon laser-cut tiles, printed cotton cloth for the board and unique clay bees.

Rules closely mimic how a bee colony actually works and players naturally learn bee ‘rules’ such as how far bees will forage (5km), using the waggle dance to tell other bees where the best nectar is located (waggle wheel spinner), and rob weaker hives in autumn (hero or hazard cards).

Name: Micro-Combat
Description:
Pathogens are attacking the population of the city! As good healthcare professionals you have the mission of thwarting this threat. Your city depends on you! Micro-Combat is a game of cooperation - you can only overcome these pathogens by working together!

Micro-Combat is a game designed to work among the young population on the subject of infectious diseases and to understanding the causes and risk factors for antimicrobial resistance.

In Micro-Combat you will play the role of health authorities who have the mission of thwarting the attack of pathogenic agents (virus, bacteria, fungi and parasites) which can make the population of your city ill. Your goal is to avoid any of the characters in the game losing all their defenses, and to do this you will have different preventive measures and medications... which are not always enough.

The game has 3 types of cards: character cards, attack cards (pathogens, "out of stock" cards and antimicrobial resistance cards) and defense cards (prevention measures and medications)
At the start of the game, 5 characters are chosen at random and placed in the center of the table. Each character has some defense points and an innate prevention measure.

The game consists in using the defense cards in order to stop the characters from losing their defense points due to the effects of the pathogen cards. Everyone plays at the same time, with no turns or player order. The pathogens are defeated through player cooperation. The game consists of 6 rounds. Each round includes the following phases: exposure (to pathogens); prevention and treatment; infection and contagion. If a character reaches zero defense points, the players lose the game.

-description from designer

Name: Ganymede: Moon
Description:
Ganymede: Moon enlarges each player board with a new location on both the left (the Moon) and the right (the Ganymede Council Chamber). You can transport councilors to this Council Chamber, with sixteen councilors in the game, each with a unique ability available only to the player who holds it. One such councilor, Marty Simon, allows you to choose an Earth shuttle from those available and place it in the column under your own board without triggering its effect or moving settlers.

Each councilor is worth victory points — 1 VP in the case of Marty Simon —and each player can claim four during play, with the last one acquired always granting a powerful bonus...

Name: Cheese, please!
Description:
Easy come, cheesy go!
Stop those mice! Use the transparent cards to cover the mice and collect cheese tokens, but remember that this game may serve you more than one unexpected course of cheesy surprises!
Contents: 4 game board parts + 1 game board frame, 55 cheese cards, 24 plastic shells + 24 cheese discs, 20 paw tokens, sand timer, stickers, rules.

—description from the box

Cheese, Please
The mice are scuttling around on a big block of cheese and it’s your job to cover them before the ravenous cat catches them in the act. Try to cover the mice with the cheese cards, but make sure the whole mouse is hidden!

     Comes with transparent plastic cheese cards!
     The game board can be changed to make the game more versatile.


—description from the publisher

Name: PitchCar: Extension 8 – The Upsilon
Description: PitchCar Extension: The Upsilon consists of two Y-shaped track components that split one track into two or combine two tracks into one. Use them as you wish!

Name: PitchCar: Extension 9 – The Adapter
Description: PitchCar Extension: The Adapter is sized for PitchCar on one end and PitchCar Mini on the other. Two track components are included so that you can create a loop that transitions from one size track to the other, then back again.

Name: Monopoly Cash Grab
Description:
Monopoly Cash Grab is a mad dash to get the cash! To play, load the money into the money blaster (a.k.a., the bank), then spin the spinner to blast loads of cash and Chance cards into the air. Rush to grab as much cash as you can to win the game — but don't stop there! Collect Chance cards to add more strategy to the game, such as swapping money stacks with another player, taking half of any one player's money stack, or making all players pass their money stack to the left. Once the blaster is empty, the player with the most cash wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dark Venture: Vile Invaders
Description:
Battle powerful enemies like the gelatinous Bohmerk, mindless creatures that become more powerful with each turn, and the crafty Dhargon, who collect resources to multiply their numbers!

Explore many more locations that profice branching adventures, unfolding through the choices you make in the Vile Invaders Guide!

The Vile Invaders expansion includes 9 new Heroic Quests, 12 new Side Quests, and over 70 new cards, tokens, and instructions that add a new mechanic: crafting.

Crafting materials can be used to upgrade items and make new ones!

Name: MON: Anarchy Phantasy Multi Card Game
Description:
A card deck that can be used in many ways. Can even be used as dice.

54 cards + 2 rule cards forms a deck of 56 cards. The deck can be used as normal playing cards from 2 to ace + jokers. But also as a Japanese Hanafuda deck (48 cards + 6 jokers). The cards can be used playing Trumps, Dingo, Old Maid and other games also.

You can also battle with the characters. Pick five random cards each and do not show your opponent. The rest of the cards is placed in a “dice pile”. The player who most recently was in a fight (for real!) start. It might be back in preschool? Pick one of your characters and decide if you want to do a physical attack; the sword or a mental attack; the candle. Sword attacks are obviously defended by the shield and candle attacks are defended by the smiley face; humour.

The opponent picks out a character he thinks can defend without knowing the attacking value. Now both player draws a card from the dice pile and add the eyes on the card's die to their value, starting with the attacker. Highest total wins and is placed in front of the winner as a used character that won the battle. Also place the die card under it, it's the price for winning; a new recruit. The defeated character is placed in bottom of the dice pile (face up) and the die card (face down).

For example: player one (Kajsa) gets Lonar, Cadran, Minx, Dag and Moog. She chooses Lonar, one of the most powerful characters in the game and attacks with brains/candle (value 8). Player two (Kalle) chooses to defend with his character with highest humour, but that is still only Silver (5). Kajsa takes the first card in the dice pile which is Ulg. Ulg has however only 1 eye on his T6. 8 + 1 = 9 in mental attack. Kalle draws the next card and gets Donolen who has 5 eyes on the T6. 5 + 5 = 10. Silver wins and is placed in front of Kalle along with Donolen. They are now battle weary and not available until everybody have fought. Kajsa's Lonar is discarded under the dice pile along with Ulg. But defeated cards like Lonar can return as an undead and is placed face up! Ulg is placed face down like all other cards. Kalle wins the battle and starts the next round.

If the numbers are even the result is a tie, place both characters in front of the players, they are also battle weary and not available. However the dice cards are discarded and not won. Continue battling until all characters have fought. If both players have character cards left after everybody has fought, pick them up again and repeat everything. Shuffle the dice pile again and remember to keep the undead face up. The one with the least cards start the next battle. If even use rock-papers-scissors to decide. If an undead gets into your army keep it upside down on your hand. When played it automatically defeats both the opponent and him/herself. Remove the undead from the game after battle. The loser is the player who lost all of his/her cards. If one player has more characters to play than the other those are rested until next round.

Try adding rules like that darker cards have +1 against lighter cards or that same silhouettes can’t fight each other for example.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zoo-ography: Connections
Description:
This expansion allows you to build your own monorail into your zoo as you try to meet new special monorail objectives for added variety and challenge!

The expansion also adds co-operative play for up to 5 players as you all work together to build a 6x6 mega zoo.  Meet all of the co-operative objectives and win!

This expansion works seamlessly with either the Retail or Deluxe versions of the game.

The Monorail Expansion adds:
- A new build action
- A new attraction
- New monorail objectives
- New co-op objectives

Includes 4 monorail trains & 14 monorail track pieces

Name: Joking Hazard: Deck Enhancement #3
Description: The third deck enhancement expansion to Joking Hazard. Mix these 100 cards in with your Joking Hazard game for extra deck enhancement.

Name: Wench: Gratitude Promo Card
Description:
This is a promo card for Wench.

The promo card is shuffled in with the other cards before the game begins. Unlike the other cards in the game, the Gratitude promo card does not have a suit or card value.

It has the following rule: "If a player does not say 'You shouldn't have...' when you give them a card, you may also give them this card."

This card was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #226 (Dec. 2018).

Name: T.I.M.E Stories: Madame
Description:
N.T. 1673: Ah ! Versailles. Its court. Its eIteTqtue.  
iTs p1SG3Tre. DO. Hdesba rgasezfl.  
FATAL 3RR0R : 3ND OF TR4NSMISSION. 1011100101.___
After this adventure, nothing will ever be the same again...

Madame is the tenth scenario for T.I.M.E Stories and promises to shake things up.

Name: Tiny Epic Zombies: Deluxe Edition
Description:
The Deluxe edition is a compilation of the base game and Tiny Epic Zombies: Kickstarter Deluxe Promo Pack.

GENERAL INFO: 1-5 players, 30 minutes, 5 play modes including competitive and cooperative play.


     Cooperative team-play with game controlled Zombies.
     Cooperative team-play with Zombies controlled by a non-team player.
     Competitive free-for-all with game controlled Zombies.
     Competitive free-for-all with Zombies controlled by a player.
     Solo.


THEME: Modern day Zombie outbreak at the Echo Ridge Mall.

HOOK: Fast paced, portable, and tons of replayability. Play as the survivors or the Zombies. Plus ITEMeeples!

WIN: Survivors must complete 3 objectives - Zombies must kill all the Survivors or gain control of the Mall's Courtyard.

OVERVIEW: In Tiny Epic Zombies, survivors are always on the run, collecting weapons, killing Zombies and working toward completing objectives. Completing 3 objectives can win you the game but if you're too focused on the objectives, the Zombies will overrun the mall and that will be the end of you.

Based on the mode of play, you will either play as one of the Survivors or as the Zombies.

As a Survivor, your turn will consist of moving 3 times. Then based on where you move, you'll be able to do additional things. For instance, if you move into a room with a Zombie, you'll have to fight it by rolling the Zombie die. Or if you move into a room adjacent to a Zombie, you can spend ammo to shoot it. Killing a Zombie is actually pretty easy... but they just keep coming. Keeping them from overrunning the entire mall, while trying to accomplish your objectives, that is hard!

After you've taken your 3 moves, you'll search the room. This is done by revealing the Search Card you are holding. Most of the time, you find something useful, like awesome items you can later pickup and equip to your ITEMeeples. Sometimes though, you may find a Zombie lurking in the corner. So be prepared.
After you search the room, more Zombies flood into the Mall. Then it's the next player's turn. Simple as that.

Note: If your ammo and wound tokens ever meet, you're dead meat! So, keep your wounds low and your ammo high.

If you die, that character will turn into a Zombie and you'll have to draw a new character to play. If that happens too many times, you lose the game.

As a Zombie player, not only will you control unique Zombies with special abilities, you will control ALL the Zombies! With your help, the Zombies will have a brain in addition to eating brains. Your game will be to overwhelm the players with clever placement and movement of the Zombies. Smother them with your Zombie horde and prevent them from completing their objectives. If you kill enough players or overrun the mall courtyard, you win.

Name: ATS To The Volga II: Mamayev Kurgan
Description:
MAMAEV KURGAN, STALINGRAD, RUSSIA, 27 September 1942: Acknowledging the damage done to his army in assaulting the southern and central sections of the city, General von Paulus had systematically reconfigured his forces for a fresh assault. Two shock groups were formed, with one consisting primarily of the 100th Jäger Division, whose task was to clear and control Mamaev Kurgan, followed by an advance into the Tennis Racket and the Bannyi Ravine and finally to occupy the Krasnyi Oktiabr workers' settlements. Paulus' counterpart, General Chuikov was well aware of these preparations and had planned appropriate spoiling attacks, though he was unaware of the fresh German reinforcements. His attack was disrupted before it could even begin, with waves of Stukas strafing his advancing forces. His strongpoint on the crest of the burial mound was destroyed. Bombs and artillery cut down the attackers, decimating their ranks and allowing the following German advance to gain ground. The jägers advanced two regiments abreast and captured the western slopes, but initially failed to take the southern slopes. The 227th Jäger Regiment's vigorous assaults, supported by intense artillery, destroyed the Russian ability to hold on. The Germans would secure the summit that evening (though some bypassed remnants would harass the Germans on the southern and western slopes for the next few days). By day's end, the 95th Division retained a foothold on the northern and eastern slopes of the burial mound, but was down to only 400 effective fighting men.

This is the Advanced Tobruk System treatment of this bloody battle which includes a large-hex map on heavy cardstock panels, new overhead (OVR) infantry and light weapons counters and the usual set of scenarios, Battlefield Walkaround document and AFV cards.
Ownership of ATS Rules, playaids, system markers and a "standard" Russian/German sheet of AFV counters are required to make use of this product.

—description from the publisher

Name: ATS The Devil's Vineyard: Heraklion 1941
Description:
When Kurt Student focused his attention on Unternehmen Merkur, the stage was set to introduce the world to the airfield at Heraklion, Crete. The defenders included British, Australian and Greek soldiers. The write up for the book by by Yannis Prekatsounakis says succinctly, “The Battle for Heraklion - an epic struggle - remained largely forgotten and widely unstudied. Yet the desperate fight for Heraklion had everything: street-fighting in the town; heroic attacks against well-fortified positions and medieval walls; heavy losses on all sides…"

Contents:
- Six 11x16" map panels depicting the Heraklion airfield and surrounding area
- Five half-sheets of counters providing all of the combat counters required
- Eight new scenarios
- Battlefield Walkaround
- One AFV card (British Matilda II)

Players are required to have the ATS Rules, playaids and generic system markers to make full use of this product.

—description from the publisher

Name: No Yolk
Description:
First you get the chickens... then you get the eggs... then you get the coins! Jump start your chicken farm and sell loads of eggs in this card game for 2-6 players. Make your chickens extra happy with upgrades like Disco Speakers and Autofeeders. Happy chickens lay more eggs, and the first player to 15 coins wins!

Turn Sequence:

     Replace any Fertilized Egg card in your henhouse with a Chicken card.
     Calculate all upgrades, then collect an Egg card for each of your Chicken cards.
     Draw 1 Action card.
     Take any 3 Actions. You may use the same Action multiple times.
     At the end of your turn, if you have more Eggs than you have space for in Egg Cartons, you must discard extra Egg cards.


Actions:

     Draw an Action card.
     Use an Action card.
     Buy a Chicken card.
     Buy an Upgrade card.
     Draw an Egg card.
     Sell Eggs


The first player to collect 15 coins wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: This is It
Description:
Three cards with pictures on them are dealt. You pick one card and write down the name of what's written on the card, then everyone reveals what they wrote at once. If you gave the same answer as someone else you get points. It sounds simple but it's surprisingly difficult!

For example, if you see brown liquid in a cup with steam coming off it, is that coffee, tea, cocoa, or something else?

There are also further complications. You get extra points for matching the dealer most of the time, so you have to think about what they'll write. If all the background colors match, matching the dealer doesn't give you an advantage, but all points are tripled! Some cards have a star on them that means points are doubled, but they might be harder to give a single name to than the other cards...

The rules are in Japanese and many of the cards are chosen with relevance to Japanese culture or language, but you don't need to read or understand Japanese to use them. (Example: there is a picture of a snail. This has only one obvious name in English, but in Japanese there are a number of words for snail varying by region.)

—user summary

Name: Road Trip
Description:
Road Trip is a spin and move game with a modular board.  It was originally a giveaway at McDonald's restaurants.

The game consists of 20 punch out paper tiles printed with road patterns.  Players arrange the tiles to create a town, then spin the paper spinner to move their paper cars around the board, trying to make it from start to finish.  The spinner determines the direction of movement rather than the distance.  All moves are one square.  Spins may also move players to one of two traffic circles or allow movement of another player's piece.

—user summary
